title: How to Allow Facebook Messenger to Access Your Photos

steps.title: Open the Settings app.
steps.content: Open the Settings app. This is the grey gear icon located on your Home screen. [1] X Research source If you can't send photos on Facebook Messenger , you'll need to change your photos settings.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Messenger.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Messenger . You can find this towards the bottom of Settings. It will be listed with your other apps in alphabetical order.

steps.title: Tap Photos.
steps.content: Tap Photos . A new page will open.

steps.title: Tap Full Access.
steps.content: Tap Full Access . A blue checkmark will appear next to the option. Alternatively, you can select Limited Access and then tap Edit Selected Photos to choose which photos Messenger can access.

steps.title: Tap Allow Full Access.
steps.content: Tap Allow Full Access . Messenger can now access your photos. You may need to restart the app for this to take effect.

steps.title: Open your device's Settings.
steps.content: Open your device's Settings. You can do this by tapping the Settings app on your Apps list. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Apps.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Apps . A list will open with all applications installed on your device.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Messenger.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Messenger . You can also tap the magnifying glass icon in the top-right corner to search for it.

steps.title: Tap Permissions.
steps.content: Tap Permissions . This includes your camera, microphone, and storage permissions.

steps.title: Tap Photos and videos.
steps.content: Tap Photos and videos . You can find this towards the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Tap Always allow all.
steps.content: Tap Always allow all . Messenger can now access your photos. You may need to restart the app for this to take effect.
